alerts.headline: Flood Watch issued June 3 at 1:41AM CDT until June 4 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Norman OK
alerts.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be
possible.

* WHERE...Portions of Oklahoma, including the following counties,
Atoka, Blaine, Bryan, Caddo, Canadian, Carter, Cleveland, Coal,
Comanche, Cotton, Garfield, Garvin, Grady, Grant, Hughes,
Jefferson, Johnston, Kay, Kingfisher, Kiowa, Lincoln, Logan, Love,
Marshall, McClain, Murray, Noble, Oklahoma, Payne, Pontotoc,
Pottawatomie, Seminole, Stephens, Tillman and Washita and northern
Texas, including the following counties, Archer, Clay and Wichita.

* WHEN...Through 7 am Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers,
creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- Widespread 1 to 2 inches of rainfall with locally 3 to 4
inches possible.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 3 at 9:26PM CDT until June 7 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...

Neches River Near Neches affecting Anderson and Cherokee Counties.

...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Neches River Near Alto affecting Angelina, Anderson, Cherokee and
Houston Counties.

Neches River Near Diboll affecting Angelina, Trinity and Polk
Counties.

For the Neches River...including Lake Palestine, Neches, Alto,
Diboll, Rockland...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Neches River near Alto.

* WHEN...Until Saturday evening.

* IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Boat ramps and picnic areas near the river
will begin to flood. Ranchers should move cattle and equipment
near the river to higher ground.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 8:15 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 16.7 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 8:15 PM CDT Tuesday was 16.8 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage
Friday morning and continue falling to 15.2 feet Sunday
evening.
- Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
16.8 feet on 11/01/2013.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 3 at 8:22PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a
Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River near Moss Bluff affecting Liberty and Chambers
Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Riverside, Moss Bluff...Minor
flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River near Moss Bluff.

* WHEN...From Wednesday morning until further notice.

* IMPACTS...At 12.2 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins in the
vicinity of the gage.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 7:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 11.9 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 9.2 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage
early tomorrow afternoon and continue rising to 12.7 feet
Sunday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter.
- Flood stage is 12.2 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
12.7 feet on 04/14/2002.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood

alerts.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 3 at 9:03PM CDT until June 4 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
alerts.description:
FFWFWD

The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Southern Palo Pinto County in north central Texas...
Southeastern Stephens County in north central Texas...

* Until midnight CDT tonight.

* At 903 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms are moving
into an area that received between 1 and 3 inches of rain earlier
this afternoon. Stream flows are elevated between Caddo, Metcalf
Gap, Santo, and Brazos due to the earlier rainfall. Additional
rainfall moving across the area will likely result in Flash
Flooding in short order.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other
poor drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include...
Gordon, Lake Palo Pinto, Caddo, New Salem, Lone Camp, Santo and
Brazos.
alerts.areaDesc: Palo Pinto, TX; Stephens, TX

alerts.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 3 at 10:20PM CDT until June 3 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
alerts.description:
SVRFWD

The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Southwestern McLennan County in central Texas...
Southeastern Coryell County in central Texas...
North central Bell County in central Texas...

* Until 1115 PM CDT.

* At 1020 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Flat, or 9
miles south of Gatesville, moving east at 15 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage
to roofs, siding, and trees.

* Locations impacted include...
Pendleton, Whitson, Moffat, Mother Neff State Park, Owl Creek, Leon
Junction, Meadow Grove, Moody, Fort Gates, Mound, Flat, The Grove,
Morgan's Point Resort, White Hall, Temple, Woodland, Belton Lake,
and Gatesville.

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 3 at 8:22PM CDT until June 7 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Houston/Galveston TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Trinity River at Riverside affecting Trinity, Walker, San Jacinto
and Polk Counties.

For the Trinity River...including Riverside, Moss Bluff...Minor
flooding is forecast.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Trinity River at Riverside.

* WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...At 134.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues with the
boat ramp in the Deep River Plantation Subdivision in Walker
County inundated. Backwater flooding up Thomas Lake in Walker
County floods the boat ramp in the Green Rich Shores Subdivision
in Walker County.
At 135.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding continues as significant
backwater up Thomas Lake floods the lowest areas in the Green Rich
Shore Subdivision in Walker County with the boat ramp completely
inundated. The lowest lying areas in the Deep River Plantation
Subdivision and FM 980 northwest of Riverside are threatened.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 7:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 134.6 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 133.0 feet.
- Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours
ending at 7:30 PM CDT Tuesday was 134.7 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 134.6
feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below
flood stage early Saturday morning.
- Flood stage is 133.5 feet.
- Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of
134.6 feet on 05/15/2007.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
alerts.areaDesc: Polk, TX; San Jacinto, TX; Trinity, TX; Walker, TX

alerts.headline: Flood Warning issued June 3 at 2:00PM CDT until June 6 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
alerts.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas...

Navasota River Near Easterly affecting Leon and Robertson
Counties.

* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.

* WHERE...Navasota River near Easterly.

* WHEN...From this evening to early Friday morning.

* IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding will occur from
below Easterly to below Highway 21. Cattle in the flood plain
could be affected.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 1:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 18.6 feet.
- Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet.
- Flood stage is 19.0 feet.
- Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage
this evening to a crest of 19.8 feet late tomorrow evening.
It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon.
alerts.areaDesc: Leon, TX; Robertson, TX

alerts.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 3 at 9:03PM CDT until June 4 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
alerts.description:
FFWFWD

The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Southern Palo Pinto County in north central Texas...
Southeastern Stephens County in north central Texas...

* Until midnight CDT tonight.

* At 903 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms are moving
into an area that received between 1 and 3 inches of rain earlier
this afternoon. Stream flows are elevated between Caddo, Metcalf
Gap, Santo, and Brazos due to the earlier rainfall. Additional
rainfall moving across the area will likely result in Flash
Flooding in short order.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Radar.

IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other
poor drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include...
Gordon, Lake Palo Pinto, Caddo, New Salem, Lone Camp, Santo and
Brazos.
